articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel sent tanks into eastern Jabalia in the northern Gaza Strip early on Sunday, after a night of heavy aerial and ground bombardments, killing 19 people and wounding dozens of others, health officials said.
articles.title: Israel pushes back into northern Gaza, ups military pressure on Rafah

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Taliban-run ministry for refugees said on Sunday the death toll from flooding in northern Afghanistan was 315 with more than 1,600 people injured.
articles.title: Death toll from Afghanistan floods rises to 315, Taliban ministry says

articles.author: Timour Azhari, Ahmed Rasheed
articles.description: Powerful Iraqi Shi'ite Muslim cleric Moqtada al-Sadr is laying the groundwork for a political comeback two years after a failed and ultimately deadly high-stakes move to form a government without his Shi'ite rivals, multiple sources said.
articles.title: Powerful Iraqi Shi'ite cleric Sadr girds for political comeback

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least three people were killed when a section of a multi-storey apartment block partially collapsed due to a Ukrainian missile strike in the Russian city of Belgorod near the border with Ukraine, Russian media reported.
articles.title: Ukrainian shelling kills at least three in Russian apartment block

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: A former U.S. Marine pilot fighting extradition from Australia on U.S. charges of training Chinese military pilots to land on aircraft carriers, unknowingly worked with a Chinese hacker, his lawyer said.
articles.title: US Marine pilot arrested in Australia worked with Chinese hacker, lawyer says

articles.author: Joan Faus
articles.description: A regional poll on Sunday offers Catalans the choice of an exiled separatist politician or an anti-independence government.
articles.title: Catalans vote in election that offers new chance to exiled separatist leader

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: As Indonesia’s president elect Prabowo Subianto prepares to enter office in October, he looks set to take a more assertive stance in foreign policy, saying that diplomacy, negotiations, and the "Asian way" have helped to defuse tension.
articles.title: Indonesia's Prabowo reiterates 'Asian Way' to defuse tension, Al Jazeera says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Stopping British arms sales to Israel if it launches a ground assault on Rafah in the Gaza Strip would strengthen Hamas, Britain's Foreign Secretary David Cameron said on Sunday.
articles.title: Banning UK arms exports to Israel would strengthen Hamas, UK's Cameron says

articles.author: Brad Brooks
articles.description: Experts say it's hard to maintain people power if most people are gone, but that energy might migrate to the streets.
articles.title: Gaza college campus rallies face next challenge: Summer break

articles.author: Gabriella Borter, Joseph Ax, Andrew Hay
articles.description: Messages call for protesters to be deported or expelled, possibly raped or killed.
articles.title: Name and shame: Pro-Israel website ramps up attacks on pro-Palestinian student protesters
